H0.text: Mass is represented by the 20 mL increase in water level in the graduated cylinder when a student places a rock in it.

H1.text: Volume is the 20 mL increase in water level that occurs when a student places a rock in a graduated cylinder containing water.

H2.text: Solubility is the 20 mL increase in the water level in the graduated cylinder when a student places a rock in it.

H3.text: Temperature is what the 20 mL increase in water level represents when a student placed a rock in a graduated cylinder containing water.

A4.text: The weight of the displaced fluid is directly proportional to the volume of the displaced fluid (if the surrounding fluid is of uniform density).

A5.text: Buoyancy reduces the apparent weight of an object.
